alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 19 at 10:54PM MST until August 20 at 3:00AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... * Until 300 AM MST. * At 1054 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of roadways, normally dry washes, and structures in low lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Dateland and Mohawk. This includes the following streams and drainages... Hoodoo Wash, San Cristobal Wash, and Tenmile Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
